body: LEAD: For years, Tony Triano of the Bronx said, the rest of the world seemed to have what his borough did not - cable television. Friends in Manhattan had Islanders' hockey games piped into their living rooms. His sister-in-law in Nyack, N.Y., could flick on movies at will. title: For Many New York Areas, Wait for Cable TV Ends

body: LEAD: Twenty thousand people live in the Marine Park section of Brooklyn, and on Sundays, after a quiet morning in church or a quick jog through the park, many head for the municipal Marine Park Golf Course. title: IF YOU'RE THINKING OF LIVING IN: Marine Park

body: LEAD: Parts of southeast Brooklyn are sinking. They have been for years, and now, even as the city begins to repair the damage, the neighborhoods continue to sink.
